meanings.definition: Covered with blades or resembling a blade.
meanings.sent1: The blady grass in the field swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The knife had a blady edge that could cut through anything.
meanings.sent3: The blady leaves on the tree looked like tiny swords.
meanings.sent4: Her blady wit sliced through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The blady mountain peaks pierced the sky like sharp knives.

meanings.definition: Sharp or cutting like a blade.
meanings.sent1: His blady remarks left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent2: The blady scissors easily cut through the paper.
meanings.sent3: The blady wind made the trees dance wildly.
meanings.sent4: Her blady gaze seemed to see right through me.
meanings.sent5: The blady claws of the predator gleamed in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier or expletive.
meanings.sent1: She was blady tired after running the marathon.
meanings.sent2: He blady well knew he had to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat blady jumped out of the box, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The rain fell blady hard, flooding the streets.
meanings.sent5: The music was blady loud, making it hard to concentrate.
